modmenu.descriptionTranslation.chattools: A toolkit that provides great chat-related features.
key.chattools.texts.welcomeMessage: New to Chat Tools? Check out FAQs here!
key.chattools.texts.toast.title: Message from Minecraft:
key.chattools.texts.actionbar.title: §a§lReceived subscribed messages!
key.chattools.texts.download.success: §6[Chat Tools] All addon files were downloaded successfully!
key.chattools.texts.toast.failure: §6Toast failed: Files are not ready or unsupported platform.§r
key.chattools.texts.requireRestart: After editing, you'll need to restart Minecraft to apply changes.
key.chattools.gui.title: Chat Tools Configuration
key.chattools.general.Timestamp.@Tooltip: It inserts a timestamp before messages.
Toggles whether a timestamp should be inserted.
The pattern for the timestamps.
& -> Color Code Prefix
\& -> &
{hour} -> Hour
{minute} -> Minute
{second} -> Second
key.chattools.general.RestoreMessages.@T: It restores former sessions even after switching to another.
key.chattools.general.RestoreMessages.En: Toggles whether messages should be restored.
key.chattools.general.RestoreMessages.Sp: If it is on, a split-line will be added to chat when switching sessions.
Toggles whether your nickname should be replaced.
key.chattools.general.NickHider.Nickname:
Your new nickname for replacing.
& -> Color Code Prefix
\& -> &
key.chattools.general.MaxHistoryLength.@:
It changes your maximum history size.
(Minecraft Default: 100)
key.chattools.notifier.Toast.@Tooltip:
It applies a toast notification when Minecraft is running background.
Only matched messages count.
key.chattools.notifier.Toast.Enabled.@To: Toggles whether we should apply toast notifications.
key.chattools.notifier.Toast.Mode.@Toolt:
§6ADDON§r: Toast by triggering add-ons. 
    Extra files will be needed. Download them manually with §o/chattools download§r.

§6POWERSHELL§r: Toast by powershell commands

§6AWT§r: Toast by using Java AWT (It usually not works. Don't use it.)
key.chattools.notifier.Sound.@Tooltip:
It plays a sound effect.
Only matched messages count.
key.chattools.notifier.Sound.Enabled.@To: Toggles whether the sound effect should be played.
key.chattools.notifier.Sound.Type.@Toolt: The identifier of the sound effect that is going to be played.
key.chattools.notifier.Sound.Volume.@Too: It changes the volume of the sound.
key.chattools.notifier.Sound.Pitch.@Tool: It changes the pitch of the sound.
key.chattools.notifier.Actionbar.@Toolti:
It shows an actionbar message.
Only matched messages count.
key.chattools.notifier.Highlight.@Toolti:
It inserts prefixes in front of the messages.
Only matched messages count.
key.chattools.notifier.Highlight.Enabled: Toggles whether we should insert prefixes in front of the messages.
The prefix that is going to be inserted.
key.chattools.notifier.Highlight.Overwri:
Toggles whether the message should be overwritten. 
The property attributes of the text will be erased and overwritten.
key.chattools.notifier.IgnoreMyMessageEn: Toggles whether my own messages should be picked out from being matched.
key.chattools.notifier.MatchMyNameEnable:
Toggles whether my nickname should be matched.
You can also do this by adding your nickname below in Allow List
key.chattools.notifier.AllowList.@Toolti:
Patterns in this list will be used for matching.
RegEx is recommended.
key.chattools.notifier.BanList.@Tooltip:
Patterns in this list will be picked out from being matched.
RegEx is recommended.
key.chattools.formatter.Enabled.@Tooltip:
Formatter allows you to format your message according to your rules.
It toggles whether Formatter should work.
key.chattools.formatter.List.@Tooltip:
It defines the rules for Formatter.
The upper content has higher priority.
key.chattools.formatter.List.Address.@To:
The server address for this rule.
RegEx is recommended.
key.chattools.formatter.List.Formatter.@:
The pattern for formatting.
{text} -> Original Text
{pos} -> (X,Y,Z)
key.chattools.formatter.DisableOnMatchLi:
If any of the patterns in this list matches your text,
we will automatically disable Formatter for that text.
RegEx is recommened.
On activating this key, the latest message of you will be repeated.
key.chattools.chatkeybindings.RepeatKeyM: You'll need to activate this modifier key as well, in order to repeat.
key.chattools.chatkeybindings.Macro.Enab: Toggles whether the macros below should work.
key.chattools.chatkeybindings.Macro.List: The key to activate this macro.
You'll need to activate this modifier key as well, in order to activate the macro.

Take key 'D' with no modifier as an example:
§6LAZY§r: F3+D -> Fail to activate
  Ctrl+D -> Fail to activate

§6GREEDY§r: F3+D -> Activate
  Ctrl+D -> Activate
The command will be sent when this macro is activated.
key.chattools.bubble.Enabled.@Tooltip: Toggles whether a bubble should be rendered above the head of the speaker.
key.chattools.bubble.Lifetime.@Tooltip: It is the lifetime (in seconds) of each bubble.
key.chattools.bubble.YOffset.@Tooltip: It is the Y offset of the bubble.
key.chattools.bubble.List.@Tooltip:
It defines the rules for bubbles.
The upper content has higher priority.
key.chattools.bubble.List.Address.@Toolt:
The server address for this rule.
RegEx is recommended.
key.chattools.bubble.List.Pattern.@Toolt:
It catches the nickname of the sender and seperated chat of the messages.
RegEx is recommended.
It should include two RegEx groups:
  §6<name>§r: The Nickname
  §6<message>§r: The Seperated Message Content
key.chattools.bubble.List.Fallback.@Tool:
If this option is on, when we found a nickname in the message,
we will be rendering a bubble above his head anyway,
even if the message does not match the rule at all.

Please note that in this situation, the message shown in the
bubble is not going to be modified.
key.chattools.responser.Enabled.@Tooltip:
Responser allows you to response automatically to specific messages.
It toggles whether Responser should work.
key.chattools.responser.List.@Tooltip:
It defines the rules for Responser.
The upper content has higher priority.
It will only respond once.
key.chattools.responser.List.Address.@To:
The server address for this rule.
RegEx is recommended.
key.chattools.responser.List.Pattern.@To:
The pattern for matching.
RegEx is recommended.
Using RegEx groups is recommended.
key.chattools.responser.List.Message.@To:
This message will be your automatic response.
{pos} -> (X,Y,Z)
{$GROUP} -> The Content of the matched group `$GROUP`
key.chattools.responser.List.ForceDisabl: Toggles whether Formatter should be off when responding.
